title.narrative: Number of capacity building activities that align with IO1 and IO2.

B. Papua New Guinea is able to accurately, completely, consistently and transparently measure and report on its GHG emissions and removals, and thereby is able to reduce its emissions and increase its removals from the Forestry sector and REDD+ sectors

description.narrative: National communications, biennial update report, biennial transparency report, nationally determined contributions

title.narrative: GHG emissions reduction from business as usual (MtCO2e)

C. B. Papua New Guinea is able to accurately, completely, consistently and transparently measure and report on its GHG emissions and removals from the land-use change and agriculture sectors, and thereby is able to reduce its emissions and increase its removals from these sectors

title.narrative: Extent to which GGGI’s capacity development activities have directly strengthened partner countries capacity to develop and implement green growth policies and investments. To be assessed on a 5-point scale balanced scorecard with a maximum score of 10.
Extent to which green growth policies adopted by governments are aligned with the four elements of green growth. To be assessed on a 4-point balanced scorecard with a maximum score of 4.

Extent to which knowledge products produced and disseminated by GGGI are aligned with the four elements of green growth and have a quality impact, assessed on a 6-point balanced scorecard with a maximum score of 6.
Number of green growth policies adopted by governments with GGGI’s support.
Number of green growth policies adopted, or investments made that benefitted from shared experiences and lessons from other countries.
Papua New Guinea's Satellite Land Monitoring System (SLMS) is improved

description.narrative: SLMS, National Forestry Inventory and Greenhouse Gas Inventory

title.narrative: Extent to which green growth investments supported by GGGI are aligned with the four elements of green growth. To be assessed on a 4-point balanced scorecard with a maximum score of 4.

Extent to which green growth policies adopted by governments are likely to lead to transformational change. To be assessed on a 4-point scale balanced scorecard with a maximum score of 4.
Number of green growth policies adopted by governments with GGGI’s support.
